verb.description: Let fall or be so wet as to shed small drops of liquid.
examples: his hands were dripping with blood

noun.description: A small drop of a liquid.
examples: she put the bucket on top of the dresser to catch the drips

noun.description: A projection or groove on the underside of a cornice, windowsill, or molding that prevents rain from running down the wall below.

origin: Old English dryppan, drȳpen, of Germanic origin; related to Danish dryppe, also to drop.
